supplements.name: Elderberry Extract
supplements.evidence: PMID:30670267 Meta-analysis: elderberry supplementation substantially reduces upper respiratory symptoms. Active anthocyanins have antiviral properties.

research.finding: Meta-analysis: elderberry reduces upper respiratory symptoms by average 4 days
research.mechanism: Inhibits viral attachment and entry, stimulates cytokine production

supplements.name: Vitamin D3
supplements.evidence: Examine.com: 1000-5000 IU/day for most adults. Higher end for deficiency.

supplements.name: Magnesium Glycinate
supplements.evidence: NIH RDA: 400-420mg men, 310-320mg women. Glycinate form best for sleep/absorption.

research.finding: Magnesium supplementation improves sleep quality and reduces cortisol
research.mechanism: GABA receptor agonist, reduces sympathetic nervous system activity

supplements.name: Vitamin B12
supplements.evidence: NIH RDA: 2.4mcg. Supplemental doses 500-1000mcg for absorption efficiency.

supplements.name: Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)
supplements.evidence: AHA: 1000mg EPA+DHA for heart health. Studies show 2-3g for inflammation.

supplements.name: Vitamin C
supplements.evidence: NIH RDA: 90mg men, 75mg women. Upper limit 2000mg. Higher doses for illness.

research.finding: High-dose vitamin C (1-2g) may reduce cold duration by 8% in adults
research.mechanism: Antioxidant, supports immune cell function, enhances phagocytosis

supplements.name: Zinc
supplements.evidence: NIH RDA: 11mg men, 8mg women. Upper limit 40mg. Don't combine with copper.

research.finding: Zinc lozenges can reduce cold duration by 33% when started within 24 hours
research.mechanism: Inhibits viral replication, modulates immune response

supplements.name: Electrolytes
supplements.evidence: Replace sodium/potassium/magnesium lost through sweat during exercise.

supplements.name: L-Theanine
supplements.evidence: Examine.com: 100-200mg for relaxation. Synergistic with caffeine for focus.

research.finding: L-theanine + caffeine combination improves focus while reducing jitters
research.mechanism: Promotes alpha brain waves, modulates GABA, counteracts caffeine anxiety

supplements.name: Melatonin
supplements.evidence: Research shows 0.3-1mg often more effective than higher doses. Start low.

supplements.name: Blackseed Oil (Nigella Sativa)
supplements.evidence: Studies: 1-3g/day for immune support. Active compound thymoquinone.

supplements.name: Caffeine
supplements.evidence: FDA: Up to 400mg/day safe for adults. Avoid within 6hrs of sleep.

supplements.name: Creatine Monohydrate
supplements.evidence: PMID:28615996,32359762 - 3-5g/day maintenance. Up to 10g safe. No weight adjustment needed.

supplements.name: Glycine
supplements.evidence: Studies: 3g before bed improves sleep quality and reduces fatigue.

supplements.name: Ashwagandha (KSM-66)
supplements.evidence: Meta-analysis: 300-600mg/day reduces cortisol 14-28%. KSM-66 most studied.

research.finding: Ashwagandha significantly reduces cortisol levels and perceived stress
research.mechanism: Adaptogen that modulates HPA axis, reduces cortisol, supports GABA

supplements.name: CoQ10 (Ubiquinol)
supplements.evidence: Examine.com: 100-200mg/day. Ubiquinol form better absorbed than ubiquinone.

supplements.name: L-Citrulline
supplements.evidence: Studies: 6-8g for exercise performance. Converts to arginine for NO production.

supplements.name: Lion's Mane
supplements.evidence: Studies: 500-3000mg/day for cognitive support. NGF stimulation.

supplements.name: NAC (N-Acetyl Cysteine)
supplements.evidence: Studies: 600-1800mg/day. Glutathione precursor. Take away from protein.

supplements.name: Vitamin K2 (MK-7)
supplements.evidence: Synergistic with D3 for calcium metabolism. 100-200mcg MK-7 form.

supplements.name: Magnesium L-Threonate
supplements.evidence: MIT-developed form crosses blood-brain barrier. 1-2g for cognitive/sleep.

supplements.name: Apigenin
supplements.evidence: Huberman protocol: 50mg before bed. Natural compound from chamomile.
